instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.D6990: What is D6990? Diode sitting between PPBUS_G3H/PP18V5 charger voltage and PP3V42_G3H power supply input, can die and cause PP3V42_G3H to be missing and have no input voltage. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.CHGR_PHASE: What is CHGR_PHASE? CHGR_PHASE is charger voltage chopped up into individual slices prior to smoothing where it becomes PPBUS_G3H.
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7052: What is R7052? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Macbook Pro no charger light
threads.message:
Macbook Pro 

First look at the computer... Able to Power on the computer. No "bong", Red Charge Light (after about a minute) and full fan spin. 

Now .. well something else has gone wrong. Now no light on the charger and 11.2v at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> (battery connected)  0v W/O battery.

I don't think I "did" anything... but must have shorted something I guess ?

Sigh..

Where to  start oh wise ones?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Macbook Pro no charger light
threads.message:
Start disconnecting battery.
Do not reconnect it until get correct <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage.

Do you get <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> at least?
Post ohm values for <RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR>/81 and <RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR>/86, measured onboard.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Macbook Pro no charger light
threads.message:
HI, 
I got very little anywhere.
I have replaced the DC in jack (820 - 2565) with a known good which seems to have helped a bit. 

I was working my way through power rails and related circuits (as I guess / assume they're related) so apologies if some of these are out of order or unnecessary. 


PPVIN _G3h_P3v42G3H (mesured at <DIODE>D6990</DIODE>) 18.09v
<SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> - 149.2 mv
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 30.5mv
<SIGNAL>PPCHGR_DCIN_D</SIGNAL> 18.5v
<SIGNAL>CHGR_PHASE</SIGNAL> 10.5mv

So based on this I would conclude that there is something wrong with the circuit that is creating <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>

At this stage I believe I have power going INTO <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> via <SIGNAL>PPCHGR_DCIN_D</SIGNAL> (@<RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>). but not OUT of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

I see on pin 24 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> there is CHGR UGATE but I am not sure if that functions as a enable or similar circuit. 

My backtracking lead me to the schematic page which has <RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR>! So hopefully that means I am on the right track!

<RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR> - 99.9k (good I think)
<RESISTOR>R7081</RESISTOR> - 60.7 (good too)

<RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR> - winner winner ? 0.577m Ohms
<RESISTOR>R7086</RESISTOR> - 307K 

.......


So replace <RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR> which would fix <SIGNAL>CHGR_AGATE</SIGNAL> which makes <SIGNAL>CHGR_PHASE</SIGNAL> work?

I shall await your response. 

Cheers

James

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Macbook Pro no charger light
threads.message:
"<RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR> - winner winner ? 0.577m Ohms"
m stands from mili, but I bet you meant Mega; confirm please.
Reading should be closer to 470K (0.47M).
However, doesn't look like Mosfet leakage.

Post diode mode to ground at L6995 and F7040.

We need some voltages for <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> too; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.
Also post exact resistance (ohm mode) between its pins 17/18 and 27/28.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Macbook Pro no charger light
threads.message:
Hi 2informatios 

Diode mode I get
L6995 0.108 _G3H on one side and 0.0 on the other (_SW)
F7040 0.413


<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> 

17 / 18- 3.2 Ohms (measured at <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR> because my micro multi meter probes are not here and they appear to be connected)
27 / 28 - 20 Ohms (similar measurement style)

<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> Voltages


 1- 17.8v
2 -  18 v
3 - 8 mv
9 - 32.3mv
15 -  (negative 160mv) 
17 - 4.5mv
19 - 5.08v
20 - 5.08v
27 - 2.7mv

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Macbook Pro no charger light
threads.message:
"3 - 8 mv"
Bad enough.

First post diode mode to ground there.
If low, remove <CAPACITOR>C7011</CAPACITOR> and check again.
If still low, change <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
If no short, replace <RESISTOR>R7010</RESISTOR>.

"L6995 0.108 _G3H on one side and 0.0 on the other (_SW)"
I'm not really sure about this; do you mean L6995 is broken/open and short to ground before it??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Macbook Pro no charger light
threads.message:
7 - 7.68 M ohms
replaced suggested. Will repost after I US all the flux away
